1.text: Score your steak to a depth of 1⁄4 inch (0.6 cm).

2.text: Choose a marinade or dry rub for your steak.

3.text: Soak your steak in the marinade for 4-24 hours.

4.text: Apply your dry rub if you aren't using a marinade.

6.text: Pat your meat down with a paper towel to remove excess moisture.

7.text: Oil the grates then add your steak to the grill.

8.text: Sear your meat on high heat for about 4 minutes on each side.

9.text: Cook the steak over low heat for 3 minutes per side.

10.text: Remove the meat when it reaches 130 to 160 °F (54 to 71 °C).

11.text: Slice into the meat to check the doneness if you don't have a thermometer.

12.text: Use clean plates and silverware for serving.

13.text: Let the meat "rest" under aluminum foil for 10-15 minutes.

14.text: Cut the meat against the grain.

15.text: Season your steak with salt and pepper and enjoy it.
